metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5458 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
When a "javascript:" URL is drag and dropped by a user into the addressbar, the URL will be processed and executed. This allows for users to be socially engineered to execute an XSS attack on themselves. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 53.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5458` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
